column4: why people gives 'LTS' much priority.... now I am feeling like LTS is nothing but a simple old version of ubuntu!!!!
the LTS versions are designed to be more stable and last longer
not to have the newest of everything
they are only supported officially for 18 months
the LTS releases are supported for 3 years (5 years for servers)
and the regular releases are more likely to get mahjor changes that break things
and I have heard of many issues in 9.10
alternatively, if you want something that is always up to date without needing to upgrade every 6 months, consider a "rolling relase" distribution such as arch, gentoo, or debian unstable
but I switched to arch a couple weeks ago
it's doesn't support many progs and it's like 'unstable' to me :(
like, after installation...some program is no working or closing unexpectedly in middle of usage... etc...
